clinical_study.official_title: Endocan; Can be a New Biomarker in Ventilator-associated Pneumonia?

brief_summary.textblock: In this study; in patients undergoing mechanical ventilation, making the day series Endocan measurements during the first 5 day to look at whether there is a relationship between the levels of VAP with Endocan. This relationship, if any, aimed to investigate whether correlated with clinical and laboratory findings [presence of fever, pathological lung X-ray, the number of white blood cells (WBC), procalcitonin (PCT), C-reactive protein (CRP)] .

primary_outcome.measure: relationship between the level of Endocan and development of VAP

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation with the level of Endocan and clinical and laboratory findings

intervention.description: to look series Endocan level for 5 days in intubated patients

study_pop.textblock: Patients whether intubated and connected to a mechanical ventilator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- over 18 age
- Patients whether intubated and connected to a mechanical ventilator
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients intubated due to lung problems such as COPD, asthma, pulmonary embolism , etc.
- Patients with brain tumors
- patients with acute and chronic renal failure
- Patients with hypertension
- Patients with previously diagnosed infection
- Patients with extubated
- patients using antibiotics or corticosteroids before bronchoalveolar lavage fluid samples taken
